title: Weight of falling object from speed data

content.question: A <math alttext="2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> object is released from rest near the surface of a planet such that its gravitational field is considered to be constant. The mass of the planet is unknown. The object’s speed after falling for <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="75 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Air resistance is considered to be negligible. Calculate the weight of the <math alttext="2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> object on the planet of unknown mass.
